title: eXp Co-Sponsorship: Double the Sponsors, Double the Support
excerpt: Key Points Already an agent with eXp? Learn how co-sponsorship can boost your revenue share Two sponsors are now allowed at eXp - Primary and…
content:
Key Points

  • Already an agent with eXp? Learn how co-sponsorship can boost your revenue share
  • Two sponsors are now allowed at eXp – Primary and optional Co-Sponsor.
  • Only Primary Sponsors gives you access to a full value-packed upline.
  • Co-Sponsors can offer personal support, not upline or team resources.
  • Sponsors earn from eXp, not your commission – so helping you is a win-win.
  • Many sponsor uplines are inactive – choose carefully for real support.
  • Great sponsors offer tools, community, production help, and revenue systems.
  • Smart Agent Alliance + Wolf Pack = top-tier support and systems.
  • Primary sponsors are named during the application process.
  • Co-Sponsors are named within 5 days of completing your application.
  • You can request to change Co-Sponsors with a valid reason.
  • eXp’s goal: collaboration, mentorship, and agent-focused success – no gatekeeping.

Whether you’re brand new or a seasoned pro, eXp Realty just dropped another game-changer. As of May 1, 2025, the new eXp Co-Sponsorship Program lets new agents join with not one but two sponsors. Yep, double the support, double the strategy.

Once again, eXp is out here lapping traditional brokerages by making moves that actually benefit you, the agent. This new twist means you can choose both:

  1. A powerhouse sponsor team packed with free resources and organized value
  2. A local sponsor who’s boots-on-the-ground and gets your market.

The message? eXp wants agents to win. But here’s the catch – only agents who are paying attention (hi, that’s you) will even know this is a thing, let alone how to use it to their full advantage. So stick around and let’s break down how to make this work for you. Here’s your handy-dandy index.

What is Co-Sponsorship at eXp?
Why do eXp Agents Want to Be Your Sponsor?
How the eXp Co-Sponsor Program Works for New eXp Agents

Sponsor Upline Red Flags (You’ve Been Warned)
The Most Important Thing You’ll Read Today
How to Choose a Primary Sponsor (This One Really Counts)
Choosing Your eXp Co-Sponsor (Bonus Round)
ReCap of the Process
The Bigger Co-Sponsorship Picture
Why Smart Agent Alliance + The Wolf Pack Is the Primary Sponsorship Combo You Don’t Want to Miss

The Wolf Pack: Elite Training, Culture, and Collaboration
And Even More from Smart Agent Alliance…
Frequently Asked Questions

What is Co-Sponsorship at eXp?

Let’s break it down without the corporate fluff.

The new eXp Co-Sponsorship Program at eXp Realty lets new agents name both a Primary Sponsor and an optional Co-Sponsor.

  • Primary Sponsor – You choose this person (or team) during onboarding. eXp defines them as the one who “most influenced you” to join, but let’s be real – you want someone who’s bringing serious free value to the table. Think: free training, support systems, people who’ll spend their time and money for your success… not just your friend or someone who said, “eXp is great, you’ll love it.”
  • Co-Sponsor – This is optional and gets added after onboarding. You’ll likely want someone local for this – someone who knows your market, can meet up in person, or just makes the whole eXp experience feel a little more grounded. But you can also just name a friend if you’re looking to pass them some free money.

Baically, you can mix and match sponsor choices based on your needs and goals. Need help growing your production with social media? Want a sponsor with a supercharged community? Craving a team that’s already built the systems and is ready to plug you in so you can start earning passive income? Yeah, Smart Agent Alliance checks all those boxes. Just saying.

The bottom line: eXp knows that agents who join well-organized sponsor teams are more successful and satisfied. But they also know agents still want that local connection. Now? You don’t have to choose. You can get both.

Why do eXp Agents Want to Be Your Sponsor?

Before we go on, let’s answer the question every skeptical agent asks: “Why would another eXp agent help me – for free?” The short answer? They’re not saints – they’re smart. Thanks to the eXp Realty revenue share model, agents who bring others into the company get paid by eXp, not by you.

Yep, your sponsor earns a slice of the company dollar (not your commissions), for supporting your success. So helping you isn’t just nice – it’s profitable. That’s the magic of shared revenue done right.

By the way, if you don’t know about eXp’s revenue share model, now’s the time to check out how revenue share works and how it can earn you loads of money while at the same time setting you up with willable income that you can also keep in retirement. Ok, we know you’re not likely joining eXp because of revenue share but trust us, once you see how lucrative it can be, you’ll want in.  So, it’s time to understand it so you can make the best primary sponsor choice – it matters a lot (psst – our Revenue Share 2.0 post breaks it down without the legalese.)

How the eXp Co-Sponsor Program Works for New eXp Agents

Before you start tossing names on your eXp sponsorship forms like darts at a board, let’s break down what you need to know about how exp sponsorship works.

Sponsor Upline Red Flags (You’ve Been Warned)

At eXp Realty, your sponsor line runs seven levels up – like a family tree, if your relatives got paid when you succeeded. But here’s the dirty little secret: some eXp sponsor uplines are more like ghost towns. Maybe you’ve got 7 levels on paper, but if 6 of them are retired, MIA, or only reply “Sounds good” to every question? You’re basically solo. That’s why choosing the right primary sponsor is key before you start filling out your forms.

The Most Important Thing You’ll Read Today

Just because someone’s your eXp sponsor doesn’t mean they’re obligated to lift a finger. Being your sponsor gets them a cut of eXp’s company dollar – not your commission – but it doesn’t require them to answer a single email, text, or desperate late-night question about your first listing appointment.

So ask yourself: if a sponsor isn’t offering clear value, why am I giving them free income? The best sponsors actually show up, offer support, and help you thrive. (Shocking concept, we know.)

How to Choose a Primary Sponsor (This One Really Counts)

Think of your primary eXp sponsor as your golden ticket – and you only get one shot at it. You’ll only get access to their upline, not your eXp co-sponsor’s. So if you want layers of organized, actually-there-when-you-need-them humans who deliver real value (not just hype), your primary sponsor needs to be part of a serious sponsor team – not just a solo agent winging it.

Let’s be honest: no single agent has the time, money, or systems to support you like a group of organized agents can. When you choose a sponsor team with a full value stack and strong upline, you’re setting yourself up for way more than just a welcome call.

So what should you look for in a powerhouse sponsor upline? Here’s what agents say they actually want once they join:

  1. A value package that they actually receive, not one that’s promised and that’s the end of it
  2. A community – because everyone performs better and is happier with a sense of belonging and connection
  3. Production support that provides the best of the best strategies and evolves with the market, not something stuck in 2019 tactics
  4. Revenue support – the kind that builds your passive income without stealing your production hours

Want a plug-and-play example? If you name Smart Agent Alliance as your primary sponsor, you get all of that. Not just hype – actual strategy, support, and a community that shows up.

Choosing Your eXp Co-Sponsor (Bonus Round)

Once you’ve signed up with eXp and locked in your primary sponsor, you’ve got five days to name youreXp co-sponsor. No pressure – but don’t sleep on it either.

If you don’t already have someone in mind, hit up the eXp Agent Directory. You can filter by location, reach out to local agents, and find someone who fills in the gaps. Just keep your expectations realistic – your local eXp co-sponsor is also your competition. So if you’re hoping they’ll hand over their secret lead gen playbook… yeah, probably not happening. Save those top-tier tips for your primary sponsor.

And don’t forget that key difference from your primary sponsor: your co-sponsor is always just one person – you do not get access to your co-sponsor’s upline. That means any value they bring is entirely up to them – not a team, not a system, just them. So choose wisely. Look for someone who:

  1. Has the time (and actual willingness) to support you
  2. Knows your market inside and out
  3. Does what they say they’re gonna do

If they can’t clearly explain what they bring to the table, that’s a red flag on fire. And, here’s the super good news – if you realize later that your co-sponsor is all talk and no follow-through, you can request a change. There’s a process, and you’ll need a valid reason. “They ghosted me after onboarding” might just make the cut.

ReCap of the Process

Find an awesome sponsor team to name as your primary sponsor. Fill out your eXp application and name a founding member of that team as your sponsor (that’s Sheldon Smart for our team, aka Doug Smart).

Find and name your co-sponsor within 5 days of your join date.

Easy enough. Just don’t rush the choice – this is your career we’re talking about, not a group project where you do all the work.

The Bigger Co-Sponsorship Picture

The eXp Co-Sponsor Program isn’t just a nice little perk – it’s a power move in eXp’s mission to be the most agent-focused brokerage on the planet. This is collaboration over competition. Mentorship over isolation. Long-term success over short-term burnout.

By letting agents team up with two sponsors, eXp is doubling down on what makes it different: a revenue share model built on support, not secrecy. And the best part? You’re not stuck relying on just one person who might disappear faster than a lead after a bad listing photo.

Wondering what this change looks like if you’re already an eXp agent? We’ve got a full blog on that, too.

Why Smart Agent Alliance + The Wolf Pack Is the Primary Sponsorship Combo You Don’t Want to Miss

Picking the right eXp Realty sponsor isn’t just about who helped you sign up – it’s about who’s going to help you grow. And when you choose Smart Agent Alliance as your primary sponsor, you’re not just joining one team – you’re getting the combined firepower of Smart Agent Alliance and the Wolf Pack, two of the most valuable and support-driven sponsor teams at eXp. Together, we’re the rocket fuel behind your production and your passive income goals. Here’s what you get:

Smart Agent Alliance invests their time and money for you to gain passive income with eXp’s revenue share program.  We provide:

  • A hosted, branded real estate attraction website to recruit agents passively
  • Webinars to attract your agents to join (without doing all the talking yourself)
  • 1-on-1 meetings to help your potential agents with their questions
  • A value-packed agent attraction email drip campaign that keeps you top of mind
  • Our high-performing Agent Website (ranked #2 in organic traffic across all eXp sponsor teams) that explains the model clearly and converts visitors – without fluff

Who else is using their own time, energy, and money to earn you passive income that can last for life?

The Wolf Pack: Elite Training, Culture, and Collaboration

As part of the Wolf Pack, you also get plugged into one of the most respected, well-connected eXp sponsor teams on the planet. We offer:

  • 2 weekly team-wide strategy meetings + 1 exclusive women’s mastermind – the kind of agent community that keeps you motivated, sharp, and ahead of the curve
  • Mike Sherrard’s Social Agent Academy Pro (a $10,500 social media system, sold for $997/year) – plus a weekly coaching call to keep you on track
  • Flipping, production, CRM & agent attraction courses that show you how to scale, not just survive
  • Private access to Wolf Pack’s Skool group & WhatsApp chats for referrals, advice, and team-only perks

And Even More from Smart Agent Alliance…

We also throw in:

  • An agent portal that simplifies everything: eXp, SAA, and Wolf Pack resources – all in one place
  • 8 customizable landing pages with built-in email automation
  • Hundreds of done-for-you marketing templates – from business cards to buyer/seller guides
  • Quick-start strategy plans for new agents and leads
  • Personal onboarding to get you launched FAST

We also throw in:

  • 8 customizable landing pages with built-in email automation
  • Hundreds of done-for-you marketing templates – from business cards to buyer/seller guides
  • Quick-start strategy plans for new agents and leads
  • Personal onboarding to get you launched FAST
  • An agent portal that simplifies everything: eXp, SAA, and Wolf Pack resources – all in one place

To sum it up? You could pick a random eXp Realty primary sponsor and hope they’ll answer your texts. Or you could choose a primary sponsor team that already built the engine, so all you have to do is drive. But, make no mistake, you can only get this immense value by signing up with a founding member of Smart Agent Alliance as your primary sponsor…because you really do need this awesome upline of hard-working giving agents.

To learn more about eXp Realty and the Smart Agent Alliance can help you grow faster, earn smarter, and build a business with lasting impact, visit SmartAgentAlliance.com.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the eXp Realty Co-sponsor Program?

The eXp Co-sponsor Program allows new agents to name both a Primary Sponsor and a Co-Sponsor, offering extra support and flexibility during onboarding and beyond.

Can I get help from both my sponsor’s uplines?

No. You only receive support from your Primary Sponsor’s upline – your Co-Sponsor does not provide access to their sponsor upline.

What’s the difference between a Primary Sponsor and a Co-Sponsor?

Your Primary Sponsor is chosen during the application process and you get their full free upline value stack potential. Your Co-Sponsor (who you add after onboarding) is generally chosen to offer individual, usually local support.

Can agents change Primary Sponsors or Co-sponsors?

The Co-Sponsorship Program does not allow agents to change their Primary Sponsor. However, they can request to change their co-sponsor. They must go through an approval process to ensure compliance with eXp’s policies.

Can agents & advisors have multiple Co-Sponsors?

No, an agent can only have one Co-Sponsor in addition to their Primary Sponsor.

Is the Co-Sponsor program replacing the Mentor Program?

No – they serve different purposes. The eXp Mentor Program is for new or inactive agents who need hands-on help with their first few deals. You’ll be paired with a certified mentor to guide you through at least three transactions and there’s required training. The Co-Sponsor Program adds potential extra support, but it doesn’t replace mentorship. However, a sponsee can choose the same person to be both their mentor and co-sponsor.

title: eXp Sponsor Regrets: What Agents Realize Too Late
excerpt: Key Points You only get one chance to choose your eXp sponsor - no easy do-overs. Lack of weekly support and community leads to higher…
content:
Key Points

  • You only get one chance to choose your eXp sponsor – no easy do-overs.
  • Lack of weekly support and community leads to higher agent burnout.
  • The right sponsor gives you built-in systems, motivation, and faster success.
  • Revenue share opportunities at eXp can transform your income – if you have a strong sponsor team.
  • Changing sponsors later requires quitting eXp and sitting out for a full year.
  • Top sponsor teams at eXp have the highest agent retention rates for a reason.
  • Smart Agent Alliance + Wolf Pack is the highest-value offer in real estate, period.

When you fill out your eXp Realty application, you get ONE shot to name your sponsor. That’s it. No takebacks, no “wait, I didn’t know better” button later. Officially, eXp suggests you pick “the person who most influenced you to join.” Cute idea. Terrible advice if you actually want to thrive beyond your expectations.

Because here’s the real deal: your sponsor choice shapes your career, your support system, and your income potential – even if you don’t realize it yet. Here’s your handy-dandy index:

First Thing You’ll Regret: No Weekly Motivation or Support
Second Thing You’ll Regret: Missing Out on Revenue Share the Smart Way
Bottom Line: Your Sponsor Choice Shapes Everything
Why Smart Agent Alliance Is the Smart Move
Bonus: You Also Get the Wolf Pack
Unbeatable Value

Frequently Asked Questions

What value does Smart Agent Alliance offer new agents?

First Thing You’ll Regret: No Weekly Motivation or Support

At first, you might think, “I don’t need a lot of hand-holding. I’m good.” Fair. But here’s the problem no one warns you about: real estate can be lonely even for agents with decades of experience. Sure, you can plan to meet up with other local eXp agents, but that takes effort.

You’ll soon miss what you didn’t realize you needed:

  • Planned weekly team meetings that keep you motivated and inspired.
  • A family-like community where you’re seen, supported, and encouraged.
  • A place to ask questions without feeling stupid – and get real answers.

Without it? You’re building a business solo. And when the inevitable slumps hit (because they will), agents without community quit or burn out way faster.

At eXp, some sponsors offer thriving, built-in communities that completely change the game.  Agents who plug into these organized teams aren’t just happier – they’re the ones sticking around, driving the highest retention rates across all of eXp.

Second Thing You’ll Regret: Missing Out on Revenue Share the Smart Way

Maybe you’re thinking, “I don’t care about revenue share right now.” Totally fair. Most agents don’t when they first join.

But fast forward six months – now you’re hearing about agents making $5K, $10K, even over $100K a month… and not from closings. They’re earning passive income through revenue share – just for helping others join the brokerage.

That’s when it hits: not building a revenue share downline is the #1 regret of long-time eXp agents. Five, ten, fifteen years in – and these agents will tell you the same thing: they waited too long. They missed out. You don’t have to.

Here’s the part no one tells you upfront:

  • Some sponsors actually invest time, money, and tools to help you grow a downline and build passive income.
  • The best sponsors give you a full value package—so good that other agents want to name you as their sponsor. And the wild part? You don’t have to do the heavy lifting yourself.

Now you care.

If your sponsor doesn’t offer a crazy-good value package, good luck convincing anyone else to join you. Revenue share at eXp isn’t about “selling” people. It’s about offering such ridiculous value and support that agents WANT to be part of your group. If your sponsor doesn’t help you build that from Day 1, you’ll be stuck trying to find the money, time, and energy to piece it together yourself – while other agents race past you with built-in marketing machines.

And here’s the brutal truth: once you realize you picked the wrong exp sponsor, fixing it means quitting eXp entirely, sitting out for a full year, and rejoining under your better sponsor. And yes, people actually do  – the right sponsorship makes that much of a difference. It’s way easier to just choose wisely now.

Bottom Line: Your Sponsor Choice Shapes Everything

Your sponsor isn’t just a person you name once and forget about.
They shape whether you have a thriving career – or a lonely grind.
They shape whether you ever build passive income that you can retire with or will to your loved ones.
They shape whether you stay fired up and inspired – or burn out wondering if you made a mistake.

Choosing a sponsor at eXp is choosing your business future.
Choose like your career depends on it. (Because it does.)

Why Smart Agent Alliance Is the Smart Move

Wondering who actually walks the walk when it comes to real support? Meet Smart Agent Alliance.

We’re two agents who don’t just talk about support – we actually put our time, money, and resources into helping you succeed.

Here’s what you get for FREE when you join eXp Realty and name us as your sponsor:

  • Your own branded agent attraction website for revenue share (future you will freak out with gratitude).
  • Free agent attraction website hosting (worth $1,200/year elsewhere – yours for free because that’s how we roll).
  • Done-for-you agent attraction webinars and 1-on-1 private prospect calls – so you gain passive income while we do the work. (Good luck finding anyone else hustling this hard for your paycheck.)
  • Private onboarding meeting to fast-track your real estate success (and avoid rookie chaos).
  • Lead-gen tools, marketing templates, landing pages, and automated email campaigns – basically everything you need to run your production business without reinventing the wheel.

Bonus: You Also Get the Wolf Pack

Smart Agent Alliance isn’t just a powerhouse on its own – we’re part of the Wolf Pack – one of the most respected, fastest-growing teams at eXp Realty with the highest retention rate at eXp Realty! That means you’ll also get for FREE:

  • Weekly live mastermind sessions with top producers who share real strategies – the kind you’ll never get from your local office competitor.
  • Elite real estate training courses including Social Agent Academy Pro – valued at over $10,500

Unbeatable Value

When you join Smart Agent Alliance, you don’t just get more value than any other team at eXp – you get more value than anywhere in the real estate industry.  Yes, it sounds crazy.  Yes, it’s actually true.  You get, for FREE:

? Full Smart Agent Alliance benefits
? Full Wolf Pack benefits
? A real community that actually wants you to win

We’re not just a team. We’re an unfair advantage.

Learn more about how eXp Realty and Smart Agent Alliance can grow your success. Play with revenue share income potential using our exp realty revenue share calculator to see how much you could earn.

Choose Wisely – Now

Your future self – and your future income – will seriously appreciate it.

Frequently Asked Questions

What happens if I pick the wrong eXp sponsor?

If you pick the wrong eXp sponsor, your only option to change is to leave eXp, sit out for a full year, and then rejoin under a new sponsor.

Can a sponsor at eXp Realty help me earn revenue share?

Yes, the right eXp sponsor provides tools, systems, and support to help you attract agents and build passive income through revenue share.

Why is choosing an eXp sponsor so important?

Your sponsor shapes your access to mentorship, tools, systems, community support, and passive income opportunities at eXp Realty.

What value does Smart Agent Alliance offer new agents?

Smart Agent Alliance offers a free branded agent attraction website, free hosting, done-for-you webinars, private onboarding, weekly meetings and elite courses (valued over $10,500) all for free. They use their time, money, and energy so you gain a passive income!

title: How Real Estate Couples Build Strong, Successful Real Estate Teams
excerpt: Key Points Domestic real estate teams blend personal life and business under one roof eXp Realty offers a shared commission cap for domestic real estate…
content:
Key Points

  • Domestic real estate teams blend personal life and business under one roof
  • eXp Realty offers a shared commission cap for domestic real estate teams
  • Passive income through eXp Realty’s revenue share model boosts wealth building
  • Clear role definition is critical for successful real estate agent teams
  • Shared goals and values drive team growth and client trust
  • Communication systems prevent chaos and strengthen couple teams
  • Playing to individual strengths boosts client experience and efficiency
  • A solid business plan is essential for scaling real estate couple teams
  • Work-life balance protects both your relationship and your business growth
  • Success stories prove real estate couples can build powerhouse businesses

Starting a real estate team sounds hard enough. Now imagine building it with someone who already knows where you hide the snacks and how you load the dishwasher wrong. Welcome to the wild ride of domestic real estate teams, where your coworker is also the person you share a Netflix password – and a mortgage – with.

While successful real estate teams come in all shapes and sizes, real estate couple teams bring a whole new level of strategy (and occasional eye-rolls). When a married couple realtor team gets it right, they’re unstoppable: blending trust, hustle, emotional support, and just enough patience to survive both inspections and family dinners.

At brokerages like eXp Realty, domestic teams even score major perks like shared commission caps – a huge bonus for couples serious about stacking wins instead of stacking arguments. (More on how Exp Realty teams make the math work later.)

So, how do successful real estate agents balance a business, a marriage, and all the fun questions like “How does a real estate team work?” without wanting to throttle each other? And what should you be asking before joining forces (or asking about Exp Realty commission splits for teams, for that matter)?

Let’s dive into how real estate teams – especially domestic ones – make it work (and what happens when they don’t). Here’s your handy-dandy index:

Understanding Real Estate Teams

What Is a Domestic Real Estate Team?
The eXp Realty Couples Bonus
Keys to Success for Couples Building a Real Estate Team

Define Clear Roles and Responsibilities
Set Shared Objectives and Career Goals Together
Effective Communication Techniques
Leveraging Partnership Strengths
Create a Business Plan That Fits Your Market and Lifestyle
Balancing Work and Personal Life
How eXp Realty and Smart Agent Alliance Help Real Estate Couples Build a Thriving Team
Frequently Asked Questions

Understanding Real Estate Teams

What Is a Domestic Real Estate Team?

A domestic real estate team isn’t just a business partnership – it’s a full-blown 24/7 operation where life, work, and laundry all happen under one roof. Unlike traditional real estate teams where agents clock out and flee in separate directions, domestic teams (aka husband and wife teams, real estate couples, or real estate agent teams built at home) live together, work together, and, yes, probably argue about who left the lockbox in the wrong car.

Every successful real estate team needs defined roles, but with a real estate couple, it’s even more crucial. One of you might dominate negotiations while the other shines in client care or marketing – and because you’re basically sharing a brain at this point, you spot the little things that solo agents and even big traditional real estate agent teams miss.

Compared to flying solo, a husband and wife realtor team gets the bonus round: double the experience, double the skill sets, and built-in emotional backup. When you have trust, complementary strengths, and shared goals, your business isn’t just functional – it’s a freaking machine.

The eXp Realty Couples Bonus

Now, if you’re smart enough to be building your real estate team at eXp Realty, congratulations – you just unlocked one of the best perks around. Thanks to the eXp Realty team cap model, domestic teams only pay one $16,000 cap, not two. Once that’s hit, you’re rolling with 100% commission – not a typo, not a drill.

What’s considered a domestic team at eXp Realty? All married persons or all persons who file a joint tax return.

This is a huge advantage for any exp realty domestic team trying to maximize profits while avoiding the classic “double the fees, double the stress” trap. And while exp realty commission splits for teams are already generous, that shared cap structure for domestic teams turns the math seriously in your favor.

Heads up, though: if you and your partner both become eXp ICON agents (where you can earn your cap back in company stock), only one of you gets the official bragging rights each year. So, choose wisely, gentlemen – or start working on your “I’m just proud of us” speech.

On top of that, with eXp Realty’s revenue share model, one spouse can sponsor the other. It’s basically like getting paid just for being married – and way more profitable than arguing over whose turn it is to cook. If you’re wondering how real estate teams build real wealth at eXp, this is a big piece of the puzzle.

Keys to Success for Couples Building a Real Estate Team

Choosing the right partner is obviously non-negotiable – good thing you’re already stuck with each other. In successful real estate teams, having shared values, ambitions, and a long-term vision creates a built-in team culture that’s tough to beat. And trust us: when your real estate couple dynamic works, clients feel it – and so does your bottom line.

Let’s talk about the real keys to winning the game together.

Define Clear Roles and Responsibilities

You know what kills real estate agent teams faster than a bad lead list? Overlapping roles. Couples who want to thrive need to divide and conquer like it’s a competitive sport. Successful real estate agents working as a team clearly define who’s handling lead gen, who’s nurturing client relationships, who’s running open houses, and who’s making sure the printer isn’t spitting out blank contracts again.

When each partner knows their lane – and stays in it – the real estate business flows smoother, clients get better service, and nobody has to passive-aggressively remind anyone to update the CRM.

Real estate agent teams (especially domestic teams) that treat their roles seriously tend to scale faster – and fight less.

Set Shared Objectives and Career Goals Together

A real estate team with no shared values or goals is like a GPS with no destination set: you’ll drive around forever and eventually throw the GPS out the window.  Shared values help form a consistent brand identity that makes clients trust you faster – and trust equals faster closings and better referrals.

Successful real estate teams (especially couple teams) check in often on the big stuff:

  • What does success look like to both of us?
  • What kind of client experience do we promise?
  • How do we want to show up in the market?

Goals are important too. Whether it’s capping faster, expanding to new markets, or earning ICON agent status, goal-setting keeps both partners aligned and moving in the same direction.

Pro move: Celebrate those milestones the same way you’d celebrate a big closing – and yes, that might include champagne or at least really good tacos.

Effective Communication Techniques

Even if you think you communicate “pretty well,” spoiler alert: you can do better. Successful real estate couples don’t just wing it – they systematize communication like it’s part of the business model.

Set recurring meetings. Use Slack, Trello, or Asana for task management (because random sticky notes on the fridge are not a communication system). And don’t just talk about problems – celebrate wins, too.

Leveraging Partnership Strengths

Real estate couple teams become unbeatable when they stop trying to be carbon copies of each other and start playing to their strengths. Maybe one of you is the social butterfly who charms clients, while the other is the logistics ninja who keeps contracts clean and timelines tighter than a listing price in a bidding war.

By leveraging each other’s natural abilities, real estate agent teams create smoother transactions, better client outcomes, and way less internal drama. Successful real estate teams know this: play your position, trust your partner, and build momentum together.

Also, support each other’s growth. A real estate couple that learns together stays together…and makes more money doing it.

Create a Business Plan That Fits Your Market and Lifestyle

Here’s the thing: a real estate business plan isn’t optional, especially for spouses building a real estate team. And no, “sell more houses” isn’t a plan.

Successful real estate agents formally map out:

  • How to scale when things (inevitably) get busier
  • Revenue goals
  • Client acquisition strategies
  • Marketing systems
  • Division of labor

Your business plan should reflect everything in this blog post, including your market and your lifestyle. Whether you’re aiming to crush it in luxury listings, first-time buyers, or real estate investment properties, you need a roadmap that supports your growth and your personal sanity.

(Yes, sanity should be an official business goal.)

Balancing Work and Personal Life

Without boundaries, your dream real estate business quickly turns into a reality show nobody wants to watch. Setting hard lines between work and personal life keeps your relationship – and your business – healthy.

Successful real estate couples:

  • Protect personal time like it’s their biggest client deal
  • Set official work hours (and stick to them)
  • Build in regular breaks to recharge

When you prioritize work-life balance, you’re not just saving your relationship – you’re keeping your real estate business energized, creative, and ready to dominate.

How eXp Realty and Smart Agent Alliance Help Real Estate Couples Build a Thriving Team

Building a real estate team as a couple can be one of the best (or most chaotic) career decisions you’ll ever make — but when you get it right, it’s a game-changer. With clear communication, role clarity, shared goals, and a strong business plan, real estate couples can build powerhouse businesses that outshine traditional real estate teams.

A domestic real estate team is made up of partners who live and work together, combining personal and professional lives to build a stronger real estate business.

title: Best Real Estate Agent Books -15 Must-Reads for Serious Agents
excerpt: Key Points Discover 15 of the best real estate agent books to upgrade your skills and mindset. Learn negotiation, client management, investing, and personal growth…
content:
Key Points

  • Discover 15 of the best real estate agent books to upgrade your skills and mindset.
  • Learn negotiation, client management, investing, and personal growth strategies.
  • Perfect for new agents searching for real estate beginner books or seasoned pros wanting fresh tactics.
  • These top books for real estate agents are trusted by leaders at eXp Realty and other virtual real estate brokerages.
  • Build a stronger, more profitable business by learning from the top realtor books available today.

Look, nobody signs up for real estate thinking, “You know what sounds fun? Being broke and stressed 24/7.” But here we are: 87% of agents quit within five years. Real estate isn’t for the faint of heart – it’s for the stubborn, the scrappy, and the ones smart enough to sharpen their skills before the industry eats them alive.

One of the best (and cheapest) ways to survive and thrive? Reading. Not the “scrolling Zillow at 2 a.m.” kind of reading – real reading. The kind that actually builds a career.

We’ve rounded up 15 of the best real estate agent books to help you outsmart the competition and build a business you’re proud of (instead of rage-quitting after year two). Whether you’re brand new and Googling “real estate books for dummies,” a seasoned agent needing a reboot, or you’re leveling up at an online real estate brokerage like eXp Realty – these reads will seriously move the needle.

Inside, you’ll find top realtor books covering negotiation, mindset, marketing, investing, and client wrangling – basically everything your pre-license course forgot to mention. From real estate beginner books to elite-level strategy guides, we’re about to stack your shelf with the tools that top eXp Realty agents and top producers at virtual real estate brokerages are using to stay ahead.

Ready to upgrade from “hope and hustle” to actual skill? Let’s dig into the 15 best books for real estate agents who want to dominate, not disappear. Here’s your handy-dandy index:

1. Your First Year in Real Estate by Dirk Zeller
2. Exactly What to Say: For Real Estate Agents by Phil M Jones
3. The Millionaire Real Estate Agent by Gary Keller
4. Think and Grow Rich by Napoleon Hill
5. Atomic Habits by James Clear
6. Mindset: The New Psychology of Success by Carol S. Dweck
7. The Go-Giver by Bob Burg and John David Mann
8. The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People by Stephen R. Covey
9. Success as a Real Estate Agent For Dummies by Dirk Zeller
10. The Book on Rental Property Investing by Brandon Turner
11. Rich Dad Poor Dad by Robert T. Kiyosaki
12. Bargaining for Advantage by G. Richard Shell
13. Sell It Like Serhant by Ryan Serhant
14. The Art of War by Sun Tzu
15. The Miracle Morning by Hal Elrod

Essential Books for Real Estate Agents

Here are 12 of the best real estate agent books to help you level up your game, whether you’re a newbie or a seasoned pro. These top books for real estate agents cover everything from mindset and habits to negotiation and investment strategies. Dive in and discover the tools you need to thrive in today’s competitive market.?

1. Your First Year in Real Estate by Dirk Zeller

Dirk Zeller’s guide is a lifeline for new agents navigating the chaotic world of real estate. It covers everything from selecting the right brokerage to mastering time management and lead generation. Think of it as your GPS for avoiding rookie mistakes and building a solid foundation. Zeller’s practical advice helps you focus on activities that drive income, ensuring you don’t waste time on tasks that don’t. If you’re serious about making it past the first year, this book is your playbook.

2. Exactly What to Say: For Real Estate Agents by Phil M Jones

Phil M. Jones, along with Chris Smith and Jimmy Mackin, offers a script for success with 30 “magic words” tailored for real estate conversations. This book is like having a cheat sheet for handling objections and closing deals confidently. It’s not just about what you say, but how you say it, and this guide ensures you have the right words at the right time. For agents looking to enhance their communication skills and convert leads into clients, this is a must-read.

3. The Millionaire Real Estate Agent by Gary Keller

Gary Keller’s blueprint is for agents aiming to scale their business to new heights. It outlines models and strategies to help you earn and net a million in annual income. The book emphasizes the importance of thinking big and provides actionable steps to achieve your goals. Whether you’re starting out or looking to expand, Keller’s insights are invaluable for building a successful real estate business.

4. Think and Grow Rich by Napoleon Hill

Napoleon Hill’s classic delves into the mindset required for success. Through principles like desire, faith, and persistence, it teaches you how to turn thoughts into reality. It’s not just about wealth—it’s about achieving any goal you set your mind to. For real estate agents, this book reinforces the power of a positive mindset and the importance of clear goals

5. Atomic Habits by James Clear

James Clear presents a practical guide to habit formation, focusing on small, incremental changes that lead to significant results. By implementing the Four Laws of Behavior Change, agents can build good habits and break bad ones. This book is essential for improving productivity and creating lasting behavioral change. It’s about making tiny adjustments that compound into remarkable outcomes

6. Mindset: The New Psychology of Success by Carol S. Dweck

?Carol Dweck explores the concept of fixed versus growth mindsets, explaining how embracing a growth mindset can lead to greater achievement and resilience. For real estate agents, adopting this perspective can transform challenges into opportunities for development. It’s about believing in your ability to learn and grow, which is crucial in the ever-evolving real estate industry

7. The Go-Giver by Bob Burg and John David Mann

Forget the “always be closing” mantra. This book flips the script with the Five Laws of Stratospheric Success: Value, Compensation, Influence, Authenticity, and Receptivity. In short, give more, serve better, and success will follow. For real estate agents, it’s a reminder that generosity isn’t just good karma—it’s a savvy business strategy. Among the top books for real estate agents, this one teaches that being a go-giver can lead to greater gains than being a go-getter.

8. The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People by Stephen R. Covey

Covey’s classic isn’t just for corporate suits; it’s a blueprint for anyone aiming to level up. From being proactive to synergizing with others, these habits help agents build strong relationships and achieve lasting success. It’s one of the best books for real estate agents looking to cultivate discipline and effectiveness in their daily routines.

9. Success as a Real Estate Agent For Dummies by Dirk Zeller

This comprehensive guide covers the essentials of starting and growing a real estate career. It offers practical advice on prospecting, marketing, and closing deals. Ideal for beginners seeking a solid foundation in the industry. ?

10. The Book on Rental Property Investing by Brandon Turner

Turner’s guide is a deep dive into building wealth through rental properties. He offers step-by-step strategies for finding deals, analyzing properties, and managing tenants effectively. For agents looking to expand into investment, this is among the top books for real estate agents seeking to diversify their income streams.?

11. Rich Dad Poor Dad by Robert T. Kiyosaki

Kiyosaki’s tale of two dads offers a fresh perspective on financial literacy. He emphasizes the importance of building assets over chasing paychecks, a lesson crucial for real estate agents aiming for long-term success. It’s one of the best books for real estate agents who want to understand the mindset behind wealth accumulation.

12. Bargaining for Advantage by G. Richard Shell

Negotiation is an art, and Shell provides the palette. He combines research with real-world examples to teach you how to identify your negotiation style and leverage it effectively. For agents, mastering these skills can mean the difference between a deal and a dud. It’s a top realtor book for honing your deal-making prowess.

13. Sell It Like Serhant by Ryan Serhant

Serhant, a top real estate broker, shares his journey from struggling actor to sales powerhouse. He offers tips on branding, lead generation, and closing deals with confidence. It’s one of the best real estate agent books for those looking to boost their sales game and personal brand.

14. The Art of War by Sun Tzu

Though ancient, Sun Tzu’s strategies on planning, competition, and adaptability offer timeless lessons. For real estate agents, understanding when to act and when to hold back can be crucial in negotiations and market positioning. It’s a top realtor book for those looking to add strategic depth to their business approach.

15. The Miracle Morning by Hal Elrod

Elrod introduces a morning routine involving silence, affirmations, visualization, exercise, reading, and writing to boost productivity and personal development. For agents juggling multiple tasks, this routine can provide structure and focus. It’s one of the best books for real estate agents aiming to start their day with purpose and clarity.

Here’s a Quick Recap:

  • Your First Year in Real Estate – Dirk Zeller
  • Exactly What to Say: For Real Estate Agents – Phil M. Jones
  • The Millionaire Real Estate Agent – Gary Keller
  • Think and Grow Rich – Napoleon Hill
  • Atomic Habits – James Clear
  • Mindset: The New Psychology of Success – Carol S. Dweck
  • The Go-Giver – Bob Burg and John David Mann
  • The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People – Stephen R. Covey
  • Success as a Real Estate Agent For Dummies – Dirk Zeller
  • The Book on Rental Property Investing – Brandon Turner
  • Rich Dad Poor Dad – Robert T. Kiyosaki
  • Bargaining for Advantage – G. Richard Shell
  • Sell It Like Serhant – Ryan Serhant
  • The Art of War – Sun Tzu
  • The Miracle Morning – Hal Elrod

These best real estate agent books offer a wealth of knowledge to help you navigate the complexities of the industry. Whether you’re seeking to improve your mindset, habits, or technical skills, these top books for real estate agents provide the tools you need to succeed.

How the Best Real Estate Agent Books and Smart Agent Alliance Can Help You Grow

Diving into the best real estate agent books isn’t just about stacking trophies on your bookshelf — it’s about building real skills that keep your business alive and thriving. Whether you’re chasing better habits, smarter negotiations, or bigger investments, these top books for real estate agents hand you the roadmap. Frequently Asked Questions

What are the best real estate agent books for beginners?

Some of the best real estate agent books for beginners include Your First Year in Real Estate by Dirk Zeller, Success as a Real Estate Agent For Dummies by Dirk Zeller, and Exactly What to Say: For Real Estate Agents by Phil M. Jones. These books cover foundational skills like prospecting, communication, and building a sustainable career.

Which real estate books help with mindset and motivation?

Top books for mindset and motivation include Think and Grow Rich by Napoleon Hill, Mindset by Carol S. Dweck, and The Miracle Morning by Hal Elrod. These best real estate agent books help agents stay resilient, set goals, and build strong daily habits.

Are there real estate books that focus on investing and building wealth?

Yes! The Book on Rental Property Investing by Brandon Turner and Rich Dad Poor Dad by Robert T. Kiyosaki are excellent for agents interested in investment strategies. These real estate agent books for beginners and pros alike help you diversify income and think long-term.

Why do eXp Realty agents recommend reading these books?

title: Your Ultimate Listing Appointment Checklist: Win More Listings
excerpt: Key Points A listing checklist ensures you never miss crucial steps or documents. Prep key documents like disclosures, CMA, and your listing agreement in advance.…
content:
Key Points

  • A listing checklist ensures you never miss crucial steps or documents.
  • Prep key documents like disclosures, CMA, and your listing agreement in advance.
  • Know the seller’s motivation and communication style before pitching.
  • First impressions matter – lead with confidence and a positive tone.
  • Use data-driven CMA insights, not opinions, to support pricing strategy.
  • Overcome objections with practiced, confident, value-based responses.
  • Showcase a real marketing plan with results, not empty promises.
  • Practice tough seller objections through role-playing to build confidence.
  • Always follow up after the listing appointment – don’t let the lead go cold.

Alright, real estate pros, let’s be real – walking into a listing appointment unprepared is like showing up to a first date in pajama pants. You’re not getting a second chance. If you’ve ever fumbled through tough seller objections, forgotten key documents, or felt like you were winging it, you know how painful it can be.

But here’s the good news – there’s a better way. With a rock-solid listing appointment checklist, you’ll walk in looking like a pro, handle objections like a boss, and leave with a signed listing agreement.  Here’s your handy-dandy index:

Why a Checklist is a Game Changer
How to Prepare for the Appointment
Running the Appointment Like a Pro
Practicing and Role-Playing
Follow Up After the Appointment
The Listing Checklist That Turns You Into a Top Agent
Frequently Asked Questions

Why a Checklist is a Game Changer

A listing appointment isn’t just a chat about selling a house – it’s your audition to be their agent. A checklist keeps you from missing critical details, ensures you look polished, and makes the seller feel like they’re in the hands of a professional. Think of it like packing for a big trip – you don’t want to show up at the airport without your passport, right? Your checklist is your passport to winning more listings.

How to Prepare for the Appointment

Winning the listing starts before you knock on the door. Prep like a pro, or risk looking like an amateur. Here’s how to make sure you’re locked, loaded, and ready to impress.

Gather Essential Documents

Nothing kills credibility faster than shuffling through your bag looking for a missing form. Plan to have your listing agreement, seller disclosures, and any required documents ready to go – neatly organized, digital or printed. Bonus points for a sleek presentation folder.

Analyze Market Comparables

Sellers want numbers, not guesswork. Do a solid Comparative Market Analysis (CMA) and plan to show them where their home stands in the market. For a step-by-step guide on creating an effective CMA, refer to the National Association of REALTORS®’ resource.

?Use recent sales, active listings, and expired listings to back up your pricing strategy. But plan to hold your final price until after you see the home and after the seller tells you what THEY think their home is worth. Then you’ll know what you’re dealing with as far as seller expectations go.

Understand the Seller’s Needs

Not all sellers are the same. Some want top dollar, some need a quick sale, and some just want an agent who will actually answer their calls. Plan to ask questions that will pull out what they want, and then tailor your approach to their priorities.

Identify Communication Preferences

If you’re a great agent, you’ll be communicating frequently and regularly with your clients.  So, plan to ask how they want that communication to happen. Some clients love phone calls, others only want texts or emails. Get clear on how they prefer to communicate and respect that – it makes working together a whole lot smoother.

Create a Standout Listing Presentation

Plan a listing presentation that will be clear, engaging, and to the point, and keep it short and visually appealing. Nobody wants a 45-minute PowerPoint. Bring printed materials or a slick digital version they can reference. And, hey, by the way, we at Smart Agent Alliance provide a great digital listing presentation, one that you can easily customize as your own, when you join Exp Realty and name us as your sponsor.

Running the Appointment Like a Pro

Alright, you’re in the door. Now what?

First Impressions Matter

Smile. Make eye contact. Be confident. If you fumble your introduction, you’ll spend the rest of the appointment trying to recover. So practice if you need to and, of course, be interested in their home and confident about selling it. And, remember, no one wants to hire an agent who points out all the home’s negatives. That just makes the seller think that you’re not the right agent to put the positive spin on it.

Present Market Insights Like a Boss

Sellers don’t care about your opinion – they care about facts. So, you already did your pricing homework.  Now bring charts, graphs, and data to back up your pricing recommendations. Make it visual and easy to understand. And if they hit you with the dreaded “I want to price it higher than that” objection? Show them the expired listings and explain why overpricing is the fastest way to not sell a house.

Handle Objections Before They Come Up

Expect objections and be ready with solid responses. If they push back on commission, break down the value you bring. If they’re hesitant to list right away, discuss market trends and timing strategies. The Mike Ferry Organization offers a comprehensive list of 40 real estate objections and how to handle them.

The key? Stay calm, confident, and solution-focused.

Outline Your Marketing Strategy

Here’s where you show them why you are the best agent for the job. Explain your marketing plan – professional photos, social media ads, virtual tours, open houses. Show them real examples of how you market homes. For inspiration, explore these real estate marketing plan examples from industry leaders.

If another agent is promising the world, remind them that flashy talk is easy; proven results are what matter.

Practicing and Role-Playing

Hey, if you don’t feel like you’re ready to conquer the appointment, even the best agents practice. If you haven’t role-played a listing appointment before, now’s the time.

Why Role-Playing Works

Ever heard of muscle memory? Practicing responses to objections makes them second nature. That way, when a seller asks a tough question, you won’t freeze up – instead, you’ll deliver a smooth, confident response.

Be Ready for Common Objections

The Seller says, “I think my home is worth more.” You say, “I totally understand, and I want to get you the best price possible. Let’s look at what buyers are actually paying in your area so we can price it right and get it sold fast.”  Or the seller says, “Another agent said they’d do it for a lower commission.”  You say: “That’s great! But do they offer the same level of marketing and negotiation expertise? The right agent makes you more money, not just saves you a little upfront.”

Nail the Tough Questions

If you can answer these questions without hesitation, you’re in good shape:

  • What makes you different from other agents?
  • How will you market my home?
  • What happens if my home doesn’t sell?
  • Why should I list with you today?  So, work on your answers to those!

Spend some serious time determining what your answers will be to those questions.  That way, you won’t be caught off guard and instead will come off as the polished, experienced, professional that you are.

Follow Up After the Appointment

Okay, the appointment is over. If you think you crushed the appointment, or even if you don’t think you did, don’t drop the ball.

Send a Follow-Up Thank You

A handwritten note or a personalized email goes a long way. Thank them for their time and remind them why you’re the best choice to sell their home.

Outline the Next Steps

Make it clear what happens next. If they’re ready to list, you will be walking them through the paperwork. If they need time to decide who they will list with, schedule a follow-up. Keep the momentum going.

Gather Feedback

You can also ask them how they felt about the meeting. What questions do they still have? Their feedback can help you improve for future appointments.

The Listing Checklist That Turns You Into a Top Agent

A successful listing appointment starts way before you ring the doorbell. With this ultimate listing checklist, you’re not just winging it – you’re walking in with confidence, clarity, and a strategy that proves you’re the right agent for the job. For more tips to gain clients, be sure to check out our Agent Success Hub.

And you don’t have to figure it out alone when you join eXp and name Smart Agent Alliance as your sponsor, we have a proven customizable listing presentation all ready for you to make it your own.  Plus, we do more:

Smart Agent Alliance runs meetings so you gain passive income and gives agents access to:

  • A done-for-you and hosted real estate attraction website
  • Social Agent Academy Pro ($10,500 value) for social media marketing
  • Weekly coaching sessions with top producers
  • Customizable lead funnels, email campaigns, and marketing templates
  • And more…

All free for agents who join through the Smart Agent Alliance sponsor line. Learn more about how eXp Realty and Smart Agent Alliance can help you scale your career. Not sure if eXp is the right fit for you? Take this quick quiz to find out if eXp is a good match—especially if support and systems matter to you.

Not sure how passive income grows?  You can play with the numbers using our exp realty revenue share calculator to see how much you could earn. Not sure how to become a real estate agent? We’ve got loads of helpful info on that too.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a listing checklist for real estate agents?

A listing checklist is a step-by-step guide agents use to prepare for listing appointments and ensure nothing important is missed during client meetings.

Why is a listing presentation important?

A listing presentation shows potential clients how you’ll market and sell their home, helping you win their trust – and their listing.

What should a real estate agent bring to a listing appointment?

Bring a listing agreement, CMA, marketing materials, seller disclosures, and a clear plan for how you’ll sell their home.

How do real estate agents handle commission objections?

Top agents focus on value – explaining how their services help sellers net more, not just save upfront.

How do new real estate agents get listing clients?

New agents can win listings by preparing thoroughly, practicing responses, and using tools like listing checklists and roleplay to build confidence.

  • Walk away with strategies, systems, and goals that don’t fizzle out by Monday.

The eXp Realty Events App: Your Personal Guide to Not Getting Lost

If you’ve ever fumbled through a 100-session conference with nothing but a paper map and vibes, you’ll love the eXp Realty Events App. It’s your sidekick for:

  • Customizing your EXPCON agenda and getting reminders before sessions start
  • Messaging other attendees for quick connections or coffee meetups
  • Scanning bios, workshop decks, and speaker updates on the fly

Want to connect with a top producer or set up a post-event Zoom with a new referral partner? This app makes it easy, efficient, and kinda fun.

eXp Regional Rallies: Local Vibes, Big Wins

Can’t swing the trip to EXPCON? Or maybe you just want more connection in between the big shows? That’s where eXp regional rallies come in.

These localized events offer a more intimate way for agents to plug into eXp’s culture without hopping on a cross-country flight. Whether it’s in Portland, Phoenix, or Peoria, regional events bring the energy of EXPCON to your backyard—minus the long buffet lines and badge scanners.

They’re a key part of how eXp Realty fosters connection, learning, and collaboration on a hyper-local level. And yes, they’re still packed with value, insight, and people who get what it’s like to chase down appraisers and explain escrow in the same breath.

What’s the Point of These Regional Events?

Simple: to build real community and offer boots-on-the-ground support where agents live and work.

eXp regional rallies give agents a space to trade market-specific tactics with people who understand their local pain points. Think less “generic real estate hype,” and more “here’s how I’m closing listings in this exact zip code.”

You’ll get:

  • Networking with agents you might actually see again (hello, referral network!)
  • Training that’s tailored to your region’s quirks, competition, and client base
  • Workshops led by agents who have actually been there, done that—and have the market share to prove it

Whether it’s pricing strategy for high desert homes or creative ways to market fixer-uppers during a rainy season, these regional convos are pure gold for real estate pros navigating their niche markets.

Why Regional Events Matter (Even If You Go to eXpcon)

eXp regional events are more than just filler—they’re the connective tissue between the big ideas at EXPCON and your day-to-day grind. It’s like EXPCON hands you the strategy, and eXp regional rallies help you turn it into results.

They also build pre-conference momentum. Some rallies offer sneak peeks at upcoming eXpcon themes, giving you a head start. Others let you dive deeper into past topics you wanted more time with—just in a smaller, more hands-on setting.

Real Estate Networking, Minus the Awkward Nametags

While EXPCON is the megaphone, eXp regional events are the campfire. You’ll still meet powerhouse agents and industry leaders, but you’ll also get face time with nearby colleagues who understand your market and speak your language.

And that’s not just warm fuzzies—it’s referral-building, co-marketing potential, and real-deal support from people who want to see you win.

Sponsor Team Meetups: Like a Family Reunion, But With Less Potato Salad

Here’s the thing about eXp Realty—it’s massive. Like, “real estate agents on five continents” is massive. But just like a big university splits into smaller clubs, sororities, or fantasy football leagues, eXp agents often find their home base in a sponsor team.

And that’s where sponsor events come in.

Some of the more organized sponsor groups—like Smart Agent Alliance—host their own in-person meetups to bring their agents together. These aren’t official eXp Realty events, but they’re one of the best-kept secrets of life at eXp. You get the global support of a top online real estate brokerage and the cozy camaraderie of a tight-knit team.

What Happens at Sponsor Events?

Honestly? It depends on the group. Some do structured training sessions that go deeper than what you’ll find in eXp World. Others keep it casual—think hiking, dinners, coworking days, or just grabbing a drink with people who actually get your pain when a client ghost-texts you mid-contingency.

Teams like Smart Agent Alliance already meet on Zoom every week, so when we show up in person, it’s less “awkward handshake” and more “hug your accountability partner and swap listing war stories.”

These events are designed to:

  • Build friendships that don’t feel like networking
  • Strengthen your referral connections inside the team
  • Learn, laugh, and maybe even vent a little with people who get it

Not Every Sponsor Does This—But the Good Ones Do

Let’s be real: most sponsors at eXp don’t organize local events or offer ongoing team connection. They bring you in… and then it’s radio silence.

But a few sponsor teams treat this like a real commitment. They offer weekly masterminds, agent training, and occasional in-person meetups to make sure their agents are supported beyond the onboarding checklist.

So if you’re at one of those special teams? These sponsor meetups are your people-powered bonus. And if you’re not? It might be time to ask yourself if your “team” is just a name on paper.

Local Agent Meetups: Because Zoom Friends Are Even Better in Real Life

At eXp Realty, agents are everywhere—literally everywhere. But that doesn’t mean they’re working in silos. Thanks to the company’s “we’re-in-this-together” culture, many eXp agents take it upon themselves to create local connections, with or without a formal event invite.

These real estate agent networking events might be as simple as coffee with colleagues or as organized as a standing monthly meetup. Some groups even host weekly Zoom calls, so by the time you meet face-to-face, you already know who loves scripts and who’s always multitasking with their mic off.

Why Do Agents Bother?

Simple: eXp Realty’s culture is built for collaboration, not competition. That tagline about being “the most agent-centric brokerage on the planet”? It’s not just marketing fluff. When your brokerage actively encourages sharing, growth, and cross-market teamwork, local meetups happen organically.

Agents gather to:

  • Swap strategies, templates, and war stories
  • Roleplay scripts or talk through tricky transactions
  • Celebrate wins (and survive the occasional appraisal fail)
  • Get that sense of team camaraderie—minus the office drama

Sometimes these local events pop up around eXpcon or a regional rally, giving agents a chance to debrief, decompress, and dream big together. Other times, it’s just a Thursday coffee catch-up where someone casually drops a million-dollar idea.

No Stage, No Sponsors, No Pressure

What makes these local meetups special is that they’re grassroots. There’s no PowerPoint, and no guest speaker has flown in from corporate. It’s agents supporting agents. And in a virtual real estate brokerage, that kind of IRL connection can make a huge difference.

Whether you’re looking for tactical advice, referral partners, or just some humans who understand the chaos of back-to-back showings, local agent meetups give you a place to plug in.

How eXp Realty Events (and Smart Agent Alliance) Take Collaboration to the Next Level

Whether it’s the massive energy of EXPCON, the hands-on vibe of a regional rally, the team bonding at sponsor events, or the grassroots charm of local agent meetups, one thing is clear: eXp Realty events are built around connection. And not the fake, handshake-and-a-business-card kind. Real, collaborative, career-boosting connection.

This kind of support doesn’t happen by accident. It’s baked into the eXp Realty culture, aligning with the professional standards upheld by the National Association of REALTORS.  Yep, eXp is an open-book, team-first, idea-sharing environment where agents actually want to help each other succeed. That’s rare. And it’s why agents stick around.

At Smart Agent Alliance, we take that collaborative spirit even further. As part of our sponsor team, you’re not just signing up for a brokerage—you’re joining a support system. We offer:

Smart Agent Alliance runs meetings so you gain passive income. How awesome is that? It’s like free money.  Smart Agent Alliance also gives agents access to:

  • Social Agent Academy Pro ($10,500 value) for social media marketing
  • Weekly coaching sessions with top producers
  • Customizable lead funnels, email campaigns, and marketing templates
  • And more…

All free for agents who join through the Smart Agent Alliance sponsor line. To learn more about how eXp Realty and Smart Agent Alliance can help you scale your career. eXp Realty events include EXPCON, regional rallies, sponsor-hosted meetups, and local agent gatherings. These events give agents opportunities to network, learn new skills, and connect with like-minded professionals.

What is EXPCON?

EXPCON is eXp Realty’s annual multi-day conference. It features keynote speakers, breakout sessions, tech updates, and networking with agents and brokers from all over the world.

Who can attend EXPCON?

While EXPCON is geared toward eXp Realty agents, it’s open to real estate professionals, vendors, and anyone interested in joining one of the top virtual real estate brokerages.

Do all eXp Realty sponsors host events?

Why do eXp agents meet up locally?

Is there an app for eXp Realty events?
